main event: A bright circular object was observed for 6 minutes in Dayton, Ohio on May 2, 1962. The object disappeared to the south-east and its observation became fainter at the end.
interesting points: ECHO data indicated that the southbound hemispheres at the time were not visible to the observer, so the object observed is unidentified.

Another sighting on May 8, 1962 in Dayton, Ohio reported a light traveling at high speed from SE to NW, the size of a star, that blinked out abruptly. ECHO data showed a rapidly moving object on the scope 5 minutes later.
The object on May 8th was described as a light, traveling at high speed, sharp and bright, that blinked out of sight abruptly with no sound.
One report included a sketch showing a curved path of the object across the sky, and another sketch showing the object in the sky.
Witnesses were asked to estimate the speed and distance of the objects, with one estimating the object was very fast, several hundred mph, and very near, just a few hundred yards away.
sighted object: bright circular object, light traveling at high speed
